title: Avengers' Chris Evans blesses us with Endgame remix of iconic scene
text:
Still iconic (Picture: Marvel)

If you weren’t aware of the fact you needed to see a remix of the moment Captain America wielded Thor’s hammer in Avengers: Endgame, Chris Evans is your guy.

Months after the release of the Marvel Cinematic Universe’s epic we’re still in awe of the legendary characters, with Cap taking his final bow as Steve Rogers.

Not before he finally got to literal grips with Thor’s (Chris Hemsworth) mighty Mjolnir, though, as he battled Thanos in the finale.

It’s one of the greatest moments we’ve seen in the Infinity Saga yet, but one fan has taken things to a whole new level with a remix of the scene.

I didn’t realize that this is all I ever wanted. https://t.co/VgE7HMiUdw — Chris Evans (@ChrisEvans) October 7, 2019

Editing the famed moment Cap grabbed the hammer for us regular punters, a Twitter user by the name of John Grosjean remixed the classic scene with a tune from 1986’s Transformers: The Movie.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And, weirdly, it really works.

Like, really, really works.

Chris retweeted the video, with John originally writing: ‘I remixed Cap lifting Thor’s hammer with “The Touch” song from the 1986 Transformer movie and it’s pure goodness.’

Feeling the same vibe, Cap, sorry, Chris replied: ‘I didn’t realize that this is all I ever wanted.’

The timing of the music with the movements, and the lyrics fitting in with every lightning bolt. Ergh, THIS is art, people.

John noticed the shout out, and commented: ‘Yes! Cap likes it, haha so glad you enjoyed it, Chris!’

Memories of him attempting to handle the hammer (Picture: Marvel)

One fan who is well into the Avengers and Transformers crossover was feeling it as they, too, chimed in: ‘This is literally EVERYTHING and it makes everything that’s wrong in the world fade away. Thank you for sharing @ChrisEvans and THANK YOU for making this @john_grosjean (this is coming from a guy with an Autobot Tattoo and a spot on Captain America costume).’

The mighty remixed moment comes after the Russo brothers suggested Cap could always wield Mjolnir, after making it budge ever so slightly in Age Of Ultron way back in 2012.

At the time, viewers were given a tease that Steve may have the power to lift Thor’s hammer, however it wasn’t until Endgame we were shown the powers for real as he summoned the weapon to end the battle against Thanos’s army.

While you could say they’re messing with the canon, in a recent Reddit Ask Me Anything forum, the directing duo faced a barrage of in-depth questions from Avengers fans who wondered if Cap always had the gift.

Anthony was the one to answer that spicy nugget, as he replied: ‘He always could.

‘Our interpretation of the famous scene in Ultron was that when he realized he could pick up Mjolnir he quickly chose not to, because he didn’t want to embarrass Thor.’
